intro: Heracleum nephrophyllum, commonly known as the kidney-leaved cowparade, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its large, kidney-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its stems are often hollow and can be aromatic when crushed. It typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters.
